alert.note: Alert for Allen; Butler; Edmonson; Logan; Simpson; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 10:48PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Logan. In south central Kentucky, Allen, Butler, Edmonson, Simpson and Warren. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.3 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bowling Green, Russellville, Scottsville, Morgantown, Brownsville, Plum Springs, Memphis Junction, Crestmoor, Mount Victor and Anderson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Butler; Edmonson; Logan; Simpson; Warren
